page.title: 11LANGRISH LIFE
page.content: Public transport to and from{Langrish} is limited to one very infrequent bus service which runs about every{two {hours}with the last bus from Petersfield at around seven pm; this service normally costs{eighty pence}. The hamlet of Langrish is dominated by the{A272,}making walking by foot dangerous as there isn't any footpath. Entertainment in the hamlet is minimal for teenagers,but there is a playgroup in{East Meon,}and a primary school. There is a close community in Langrish as the one place to meet and talk is the church, the other way to keep in touch is the local magazine; "{The {Squeaker"} published four times a year by locals, is a free magazine giving news and views about matters in the region. There are plans to divert the lorries away from the A272, and the bus service will have to end.
